reviewText: Hayley Westenra has an amazing voice, pure and heavenly. This DVD is a concert based on the songs from her first CD "Pure". You'll find excellent renditions of Dark Waltz, Wuthering Heights, Who Painted the Moon Black, among others. Personally, Wuthering Heights is my favorite, though I think she displays her vocal prowess the most in Ave Maria and Quanta Qualia from her second disk.

reviewText: The first time I heard Hayley Westenra was from the wonderful Celtic Woman Slane Castle concert. Before then I didnot knnow who she was. But after hearing her I want to hear more. So I decided to not only buy her CD "Celtic Treasures" in the UK it is just tiled " Treasures". I am certainly glad I purchased both of them. They are both so well done. This DVD was filmed in her home country of New Zealand in the beautiful Wespac Saint James Theater. She performed such amazing songs as "River of Dreams", Amazing Grace and Mary did you know". From the opener of the concert with the musical island boys to "Hine e Hine" this is a concert that you will want to see over and over. Along with this wonderful concert you have bonus features like interviews with not only Hayley, but her family, voice trainer and her school teacher. There is along the "Pokarekare Ana music video" her performance of " I Dreamed a Dream" when she as only 14 and a look at the country of New Zealand. This ia must buy DVD!
summary: Hayley Westenra : Live for New Zealand is simply wonderful!

reviewText: This is an outstanding recording of Hayley Westenra at age 17 at St. James Theatre in Wellington NZ. reviewText: This is an immensely enjoyable concert. Hayley Westenra tackles the entire gamut of music from classical, to folk, to bluegrass, to gospel, to pop. And she makes them all sound perfectly delightful. Recorded at St. James Theatre in Wellington NZ in August 2004 after her triumphant international tour, it showcases the talents of a truly gifted young singer who was only 17 years old at the time. By then her CD album had already become the fastest selling debut album in the history of the UK classical charts and had achieved multi-platinum status in both New Zealand and the UK.It's fitting that Hayley opens and closes her concert with Maori music, something which distinguishes her from other international singers. After a traditional haka greeting delivered by the Te Orowai Maori Dance Group, she launches into "Pokarekare Ana", quite possibly the most well known song to come from New Zealand and the epitome of polynesian music. She ends with one of the most resplendant renditions of "Hine e Hine" (Girl O Girl) I've ever come across, duetting with the baritone Teddy Tahu Rhodes (what a gloriously resonant voice) and backed by the heavenly sounding Wellington Cathedral Choir, giving this intimate and heartbreaking old Maori lovesong an almost heroic grandeur. In between is a whole panoply of songs that showcase her amazingly pure and rich soprano voice. I particularly enjoyed "In Trutina" from Orff's "Carmina Burana", and the Cantilena from Villa-Lobos' "Bachianas Brasileiras No.5". There's a lovely version of Enya's "May It Be" from The Lord Of The Rings, accompanied by panoramic vistas of New Zealand. There's gospel music, ranging from the Bluegrass standard, "Down To The River To Pray" (in Alison Krauss' arrangement) to the very traditional and beautifully done "Amazing Grace". "River Of Dreams" is a vocal rendition of the slow movement of Vivaldi's Winter from the Four Seasons while "Never Say Goodbye" is a modern vocal arrangement of Ravel's "Pavane Pour Une Infante Defunte". The Bach/Gounod "Ave Maria" is given a modern English translation. And she delivers a lovely rendition of the Joni Mitchell classic "Both Sides Now".Extras include a 29 min documentary on Hayley, an 11 min tour of New Zealand, titled "100% New Zealand", courtesy of the NZ Tourism Office, with Hayley plugging her hometown Christchurch, a picture gallery accompanied by "Who Painted The Moon Black", a memorabilia slideshow to the accompaniment of "Across The Universe Of Time", the music video of "Pokarekare Ana" and a separate concert recording of Hayley singing "I Dreamed A Dream" from Les Miserable.The DVD from Decca is very well done. The main feature is shot in high defintion widescreen 1.78:1 (enhanced for widescreen TV) with the image appearing crystal clear. The Hayley documentary, the "I Dreamed A Dream" concert short, and the picture and memorabilia slideshows are similarly all in anamorphic widescreen. The "Pokarekare Ana" music video and the New Zealand tour are in 1.33:1 fullscreen. The documentary "100% New Zealand" suffers from rather pronounced motion artifacts probably arising from a poor PAL to NTSC conversion. It's a pity because it's a gorgeous travelogue of New Zealand. If LOTR didn't make you want to visit New Zealand, this video surely will. Sound for the concert is in both Linear PCM stereo and Dolby 5.1 Surround. While some may prefer the immersion of the 5.1 surround, take note that the PCM uncompressed sound is of audiophile quality (even better than on CD). An altogether excellent concert on an excellent DVD. No regrets buying this one.
summary: New Zealand's Singing Sensation is finally on DVD

reviewText: I have a new favorite soprano!  This beautiful young lady from Christchurch, NZ is blessed with a voice that is best described as a pitch-perfect incredibly-valued instrument.  The show opens with a traditional New Zealand Maori Haka, and a song or two includes the Maori language.  I regret I am only allowed to offer a 5-star rating; this show deserves so many more stars!  She is accompanied by a couple of local singers who are also great talents, but they don't take away from the wonderful entertainment that Hayley herself brings to the stage. There is a backup group of musicians, all of whom are likewise excellent talents. A few bonus tracks on the DVD add to the enjoyment one must receive in the viewing.  I was initially awed by this young lady when she once some time ago sang with the Celtic Woman on one of their shows, itself a marvelous entertainment package.  She has a brilliant future ahead of her, and New Zealand should consider her a National Treasure!

reviewText: AT LAST! A live DVD of Hayley Westenra in concert, shot in her native New Zealand. This is a real treat, as it offers you not only a live performance spotlighting the young beauty and her smooth and alluringly pure voice, but also cameos of her wonderful family and a delicious taste of her rich New Zealand culture. We even get a glimpse of her younger sister Sophie as the two girls sing together on one song. When Hayley Westenra performs, the heavenly angels' jaws drop, and you will see precisely why when you view this DVD. Such simple, natural elegance and complete professionalism are rare for one of such tender years, and it is sheer joy to behold. Your life will be enriched by this performance.  Buy this DVD---you will NEVER regret it!

reviewText: I ordered this DVD and eagerly waited for it to arrive.  I love Hayley's voice, and I really wanted to see (and hear) what she was like in a concert setting.  I wasn't disappointed.I have her "Pure" album, and many of those songs are included in this lovely concert.  Highlights included "Across the Universe of Time", in which she sings with younger sister, Sophie; "Both Sides Now", an oldie but a goodie; "Wuthering Heights", which, to my ears, sounds even better here than on the album; "Ave Maria/Down to the River/Amazing Grace", spiritual American-type songs with Maori backup; and "Aria"... wow!  That one was incredible.  No words... just Hayley using her amazing voice as an instrument.I hope that her next album includes some of the songs in this concert that weren't on her first album.  She's proved she can sing so many different types of songs.In addition, I had no problems playing it on our notoriously picky DVD player.Highly recommended!

reviewText: I just received my copy of Hayley Westenra, "Live From New Zealand," and must say that after watching her performance, I was totally blown away!  Hayley is amazing in concert!  The St. James Theatre was the perfect venue.  The bonus features on the DVD are a nice treat after the concert.  The interview with Hayley is very interesting and gives a lot of background on how she started out in the music industry.  I really enjoyed the short documentary on the beautiful island of New Zealand.  The video performance of Hayley's signature hit, "Pokarekare Ana," is excellent and shows off the beautiful beach area of "Cathedral Cove."  Overall an excellent DVD.  I can't wait for her next album, due out in the fall of 2005.  GO HAYLEY!!

reviewText: This is by far and away my favorite "pop" vocalist concert to date.  I've probably watched/listened to the concert five times already, and have yet to tire of it.Haley brings a tonal purity and vocal honesty pleasantly devoid of the gimmickery so prevelant among the rank-and-file on the teen pop scene.  In addition, Miss Westenra brings with her an uncannily mature stage presence and comportment, making this concert both an audible and visual delight.  Her rendition of "Both Sides Now" is simply the best I've heard or perhaps ever will hear, I believe.Two sour notes, though, which have to do not with Haley's superlative performance, but rather with a few of the arrangements themselves:(a) The opening and closing numbers gave what I think was little more than "lip service" to the native peoples.  Why didn't they vocally accompany Haley?  It was odd and even unsettling to see two Anglo-colonials sing the closing Maori piece, with the indigenous peoples standing around mute and merely tokenesque.(b) The lyrical destruction of Gounod's Ave Maria was, quite frankly, an embarrassment.  Who supplants the latin "Sancta Maria" with something as banal as "Hey there, Maria" and hopes to get away with it?  The Ave Maria is a timeless, masterful prayer that deserves better.  Well, in a way it is understandable, in light of Protestants' extreme awkwardness about the Blessed Virgin.  (I can't imagine how Protestants who enter into heaven will continue to employ such duck-and-cover techniques with the Mother of Our Lord for an eternity!)That said, this concert still easily earns 5 stars.  Haley really brings us a much-needed and long-awaited breath of fresh air, especially in the wake of Britney Spears, Jessica Simpson and the like.  I sincerely pray never to see Haley on the cover of the National Enquirer!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This wondrous DVD deserves nothing less than Five Huge Stars. New Zealand's  Hayley Westenra is still shy of 20 years old, but has been a runaway international sensation for several years now since the release of "Pure". This DVD was somewhat of a homecoming from her international home in London, lifted from her first TV special in Wellington, New Zealand. In a beautifully orchestrated and designed stage setting, she demonstrates her astounding ability to sing virtually anything of merit and make it her own, even "Both Sides Now".It's particularly gratifying that she begins the concert with New Zealand's beginning: it's Maori indigenous people, with flutes and shells in a traditional song and dance, then she beautifully sings "Pokarekare Ana" (Come Back to Me) in dialect. She keeps the Maori influence interwoven throughout the concert. Although Charlotte Church may appear to be an influence, she cites Kate Bush as the main one.My favorite, "Pieces De Resistance", are the wordless "Aria (Cantilena)" which is actually "Bachianas Brasileiras"; "Across the Universe of Time" harmonizing with her younger sister Sophie; "May It Be" (from "Lord of the Rings"); the "Ave Maria"; the "100% Pure New Zealand" video; Kate Bush's "Wuthering Heights"; the wonderful "How Many Stars" duet with New Zealand's newest opera star, Teddy Tahu Rhodes; and the encore number "Hine E Hine" (Maiden, O Maiden). Wonderful orchestra and vocal background groups and cinematography that any singer would love to have. This is mesmerizing music delivered by an incredible singer who makes it look so easy.  DVD extras are extensive with long interviews and videos. A great concert DVD that'll look marvelous on your big screen TV! Highly Recommended! Five Huge Stars.
summary: VOICE OF AN ANGEL, SOUL OF NEW ZEALAND, IN A BEAUTIFUL DVD
